habitat_description: The affinis subspecies of the Vesper sparrow ranges from the Puget Sound region of Washington to extreme northern California west of the Cascade mountains. It occupies a broad range of grassland habitat types, including native prairie, old fields, pastures, haylands, weedy fencelines, croplands, weedy roadsides, and woodland edges with scattered trees and shrubs. Probably requires song perches, such as fences, shrubs, crop residue, tall weeds, woodlands bordering fields (Best and Rodenhouse 1984). Elevation of breeding habitat ranges from sea level to 3,000 m (Ligon 1961)(quoted directly from Jones and Cornerly 2002). In eastern Oregon, the species Pooecetes gramineus breeds in areas > 4ha and in higher abundance at elevations above 1220m (Jones and Cornerly 2002).
